summary: The Small Business Administration’s 8(a) program provides business development support to small, disadvantaged businesses—including firms owned by Alaska Native Corporations. Such entities are known as ANC-owned firms. We previously reviewed participation by ANC-owned firms in this program, and testified about a number of issues that we identified between 2006 and 2016 regarding how SBA monitors and oversees these firms. For instance, SBA was not able...
title: Small Business Administration: Steps Taken on Long-Standing Weaknesses in SBA's Oversight of Tribal 8(a) Firms, but Additional Actions Needed
